page.title: 07Wingate-V Bomber Crash 1971
page.content: On Friday January 8th 1971, Wingate suffered the{disaster that never was. A Royal Air Force Vulcan bomber had got into difficulties over Northumberland and was attempting to reach an airfield in Yorkshire. The aircraft was first spotted by children in the playground having their morning break. They saw parachutes leave the plane. Seconds later the teacher on duty saw the aircraft begin to dive. It was heading for the school. The roar of the engines was fantastic. It was no more than a couple of hundred feet up when the nose lifted and the plane eased away from the school and crashed about 400 metres away from the school. It appeared that someone had deliberately steered the aircraft away. It crashed in a tiny field among many houses. No-one was hurt.
